concept.title: Displaying the entire drawing
concept.shortdesc: ZOOM Extents displays a view that includes all of the objects in the drawing as large as possible. The view can display the objects on layers that are turned off but do not include objects on frozen layers.

conbody.p: ZOOM All displays all of the objects within either the user-defined limits or the drawing extents, whichever view is larger.

You can use the Zoom All tool on the zoomtoolbar to display an entire drawing. If you have drawn any entities outside the defined limits of the drawing, the extents of the drawing are displayed. If you drew all entities within the limits of the drawing, the drawing is displayed all the way to the drawing limits.
The Zoom Extents tool on the zoomtoolbar displays the drawing to its extents, making the image fill the
display to the greatest possible magnification.
